title: Hajdu-Cheney Syndrome: Epidemiology and Diagnostic Challenges
short_description: Clinical overview of Hajdu-Cheney syndrome, an extremely rare disorder with over 80 documented cases in medical literature.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological information about Hajdu-Cheney syndrome, a rare genetic disorder with limited documented prevalence data. The text highlights the diagnostic challenges associated with rare disorders, noting that more than 80 affected individuals have been described in medical literature, though the exact prevalence and incidence remain unknown due to frequent underdiagnosis and misdiagnosis. The document emphasizes the difficulties in determining the true frequency of rare disorders in the general population, making this a valuable resource for understanding the epidemiological landscape of Hajdu-Cheney syndrome.
